Description: Rim and body sherd of South Ionian pottery cup with everted rim; interior: reserved band at top of rim, glazed black below; exterior: black band at top of rim; faint dilute lines below; band at top of handle zone, rest reserved; lower wall glazed; inscription on exterior.
Type series: Vallet and Villard Ionian Cup Type A2 (possibly)
Curator's comments: Although Schlotzhauer (Schlotzhauer 2012) does not discuss this sherd, the high rim and exterior decoration find parallels with his South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 5C. These cups are amongst the earliest South Ionian cups at Naukratis and are relatively rare at the site. These cups coincide with Petrie’s class L1 (Petrie 1886, 18), Hayes’ Ionian Cup Type IX (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116), and Vallet and Villard's Ionian Cup Type A2 (Vallet and Villard, 1964, 87-88). The number in Petrie's catalogue, 315, is written in ink on the exterior surface of the sherd.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIII, no. 315)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 669, no. 276)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.258, no.13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.082) (Phase 3)
